dict.string: Generate icons from emoji or SF Symbols

if [ "$useBg" = 1 ]; then convert -background $bg_colour -font /Library/Fonts/$fontWeight -fill $fg_colour -gravity "center" -size "256x256" caption:"$glyph" +repage -depth 8 "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -bordercolor $bg_colour -border 5% -resize "256x256" "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -matte $bgRoundness -compose DstIn -composite "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" else convert -background none -font /Library/Fonts/$fontWeight -fill $fg_colour -gravity "center" -size "256x256" caption:"$glyph" +repage -depth 8 "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" fi
cp -f DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png F29DB020-E6BD-4876-8E0C-26A9877DD1C2.png

colour=$1 hex_colour="#$colour" save_path="${alfred_workflow_data}/swatch_icons/$1.png"
convert -size 256x256 xc:$hex_colour "$save_path"
# use an existing image to cut out the alpha convert $save_path -matte $bgRoundness \ -compose DstIn -composite "$save_path"
# add some margin around the whole icon convert $save_path -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "$save_path"

import json import os
alfred_workflow_data = os.getenv("alfred_workflow_data") alfred_preferences = os.getenv("alfred_preferences") alfred_workflow_uid = os.getenv("alfred_workflow_uid") filename = "swatch.json"
# Set defaults path defaults_path = os.path.join(alfred_preferences, "workflows", alfred_workflow_uid, "defaults")
# Set input path input_path = os.path.join(alfred_workflow_data, filename)
# Read the JSON file with open(input_path) as file: input_json = json.load(file)
# Add workflow data path to the beginning of every icon path for item in input_json["items"]: item["icon"]["path"] = alfred_workflow_data + "/swatch_icons/" + item["icon"]["path"]
json_data = json.dumps(input_json, indent=4)
print(json_data)

colour=$1 hex_colour="#$colour" save_path="${alfred_workflow_data}/swatch_icons/foreground.png"
convert -size 256x256 xc:$hex_colour "$save_path"
# use an existing image to cut out the alpha convert $save_path -matte $bgRoundness \ -compose DstIn -composite "$save_path"
# add some margin around the whole icon convert $save_path -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "$save_path"

if [ "$useBg" = 1 ]; then convert -background $bg_colour -font /Library/Fonts/$fontWeight -fill $fg_colour -gravity "center" -size "256x256" caption:"$glyph" +repage -depth 8 "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -bordercolor $bg_colour -border 5% -resize "256x256" "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -matte $bgRoundness -compose DstIn -composite "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" else convert -background none -font /Library/Fonts/$fontWeight -fill $fg_colour -gravity "center" -size "256x256" caption:"$glyph" +repage -depth 8 "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" convert "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png" fi
cp -f DBDC800C-892D-4517-833A-8ABC465E948E.png F29DB020-E6BD-4876-8E0C-26A9877DD1C2.png

colour=$1 hex_colour="#$colour" save_path="${alfred_workflow_data}/swatch_icons/background.png"
convert -size 256x256 xc:$hex_colour "$save_path"
# use an existing image to cut out the alpha convert $save_path -matte $bgRoundness \ -compose DstIn -composite "$save_path"
# add some margin around the whole icon convert $save_path -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "$save_path"
set output to (system attribute "output") set the clipboard to (read (POSIX file output) as {«class PNGf»})

if [ "$useBg" = 1 ]; then convert -background $bg_colour -font /Library/Fonts/$fontWeight -fill $fg_colour -gravity "center" -size "256x256" caption:"$glyph" +repage -depth 8 "$output" convert $output -bordercolor $bg_colour -border 5% -resize "256x256" "$output" convert $output -matte $bgRoundness -compose DstIn -composite "$output" convert $output -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "$output" else convert -background none -font /Library/Fonts/$fontWeight -fill $fg_colour -gravity "center" -size "256x256" caption:"$glyph" +repage -depth 8 "$output" convert $output -matte -bordercolor none -border "$margin_percent"% "$output" fi

# Alfred Icon Generator This workflow will convert a single Emoji or SF Symbol to an icon (png file) and place it on the clipboard. Handy for adding icons in your Alfred workflows.
## Dependencies: SF Symbols - https://developer.apple.com/sf-symbols/ ImageMagick Pillow (for Python)
## Configuration In the workflow's configuration you can adjust the SF Symbol weight, colour and background settings, as well as define the location on disk where icons are generated (defaults to /tmp)
## There's 2 ways to run the workflow
1. Clipboard method Copy either a single symbol from SF symbols, or a single emoji to the clipboard. Now run the trigger. The workflow has converted the source into a png image and copied it to your clipboard - ready to paste into any icon field within Alfred (or wherever you like).
2. Universal Action method Select a single symbol / emoji and execute the workflow through Alfred's univeral action feature.
## Acknowledgements
The SF Symbols portion of this workflow was adapted from work by Mark Gavin - https://labs.appligent.com/pdfblog/convert-sf-symbols-to-images/
This wouldn't be possible without the help of user Vitor from the Alfred forum.
Flag that we are creating an icon so should return here
Generate icon preview Saving this over workflow object icons in workflow folder
Options Menu --- Note --- The icon for this object is being replaced dynamically
Force bg_colour to update in session
See note in the script file about also checking for the existence of the icons folder
Force fg_colour to update in session
Swatch Picker Menu --- Note --- The icon for this object is being replaced dynamically
Additional margin around the icon. Around 0 to 10 works best.
By default, generated icons are saved to temporary storage. To save them elsewhere, set a location.
